channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Smooth concordance of cables of the figure-eight knot
item.description: arXiv:2505.03720v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that every nontrivial cable of the figure-eight knot has infinite order in the smooth knot concordance group. Our main contribution is a uniform proof that applies to all $(2n,1)$-cables of the figure-eight knot. To this end, we introduce a family of concordance invariants $\kappa_R^{(k)}$, defined via $2^k$-fold branched covers and real Seiberg--Witten Floer $K$-theory. These invariants generalize the real $K$-theoretic Fr\o yshov invariant developed by Konno, Miyazawa, and Taniguchi.
item.dc:creator: Sungkyung Kang, JungHwan Park, Masaki Taniguchi

item.title: Poisson boundaries of building lattices and rigidity with hyperbolic-like targets
item.description: arXiv:2505.02855v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that a Poisson boundary of any regular thick Euclidean building, as well as lattices thereof is the space of chambers at infinity of the building with the harmonic measure class. We then use this result to generalize rigidity results of Guirardel-Horbez-L\'ecureux on morphisms and cocycles from lattices in buildings to groups with negative curvature properties.
item.dc:creator: Antoine Derimay

item.title: Normal $4$-pseudomanifolds with a relative 2-skeleton
item.description: arXiv:2505.03413v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The study of face-number-related invariants in simplicial complexes is a central topic in combinatorial topology. Among these, the invariant $g_2$ plays a significant role. For a normal $d$-pseudomanifold $K$ ($d \geq 3$), it is known that $g_2(K) \geq g_2(lk(v, K))$ for every vertex $v$. If $K$ has at most two singularities and satisfies $g_2(K) = g_2(lk(t, K))$ for a singular vertex $t$, then $g_3(K) \geq g_3(lk(t,K))$ holds. A normal $d$-pseudomanifold $K$ is called $g_2$- and $g_3$-optimal if $g_2(K) = g_2(lk (t,K))$ and $g_3(K) = g_3(lk (t,K))$ for a singular vertex $t$. In this article, we establish structural results for normal $4$-pseudomanifolds under $g_2$- and $g_3$-optimality conditions. We show that if $K$ is a normal $4$-pseudomanifold with exactly one singular vertex $t$ and is $g_2$- and $g_3$-optimal at $t$, then $K$ can be obtained from boundary complexes of $5$-simplices through a sequence of operations of types vertex foldings and connected sums. When $K$ has exactly two singularities and is $g_2$- and $g_3$-optimal at one singular vertex, it is derived from the boundary complexes of $4$-simplices through a sequence of operations of types one-vertex suspensions, vertex foldings, and connected sums. Alternatively, we prove that if $K$ has two singular vertices and is $g_2$- and $g_3$-optimal at one of them, then it arises from boundary complexes of $5$-simplices through a sequence of operations of types vertex foldings, edge foldings, and connected sums.
item.dc:creator: Biplab Basak, Mangaldeep Saha, Sourav Sarkar

item.title: On winding numbers of almost embeddings of $K_4$ in the plane
item.description: arXiv:2501.15642v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $K_4$ be the complete graph on four vertices. Let $f$ be a continuous map of $K_4$ to the plane such that $f$-images of non-adjacent edges are disjoint. For any vertex $v \in K_4$ take the winding number of the $f$-image of the cycle $K_4 - v$ around $f(v)$. It is known that the sum of these four integers is odd. We construct examples showing that this is the only relation between these four numbers.
item.dc:creator: Emil Alkin, Alexander Miroshnikov

item.title: Cohomotopy Sets of $(n-1)$-connected $(2n+2)$-manifolds for small $n$
item.description: arXiv:2410.16055v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $M$ be a closed orientable $(n-1)$-connected $(2n+2)$-manifold, $n\geq 2$. In this paper we combine the Postnikov tower of spheres and the homotopy decomposition of the reduced suspension space $\Sigma M$ to investigate the cohomotopy sets $\pi^\ast(M)$ for $n=2,3,4$, under the assumption that $M$ has $2$-torsion-free homology. All cohomotopy sets $\pi^i(M)$ of such manifolds $M$ are characterized except $\pi^4(M)$ for $n=3,4$.
item.dc:creator: Pengcheng Li, Jianzhong Pan, Jie Wu
